moves.2... Nf6 3. Nc3: Pretty much the standard line here.
moves.3... Nc6 4. d4 cxd4 5. Nxd4 e6 6. g3: I ummed and ahhhed about NxN but in the end opted for developing my major pieces  so g3 making room for Bg2
moves.6... Qb6 7. e3: Nxc6 wasn't an option as his queen would end up on c6 compromising my Rook on h1
moves.7... Bb4 8. Bd2: Candidate moves were Ne3 or Bd2 so Bd2 developed the game
moves.9... Qxd4 10. Qe2: The Q needs to get into the action. I suspect Pete move his N into the attack next.
moves.10... d5 11. O-O-O: It seems the expedient thing to move the King from the Q's line of fire and put the rook in its place.....Pete has advised this was a mistake!
moves.11... Qxc4 12. Qxc4: Well I figure a Q swap is my best option here....
moves.12... dxc4 13. Nb5 Bxd2+ 14. Rxd2: The decision was which to take with ...King or Rook?   I decided not to block the rook in and it also gives me a line on an open file.
moves.14... Ke7 15. Bxc4 Bd7 16. Nc3: I don't want to do an exchange which would leave Pete with a N and me with a B in the end game. Nc3 to give me time to move the king who is vulnerable on c file
moves.16... Rac8 17. Bd3: Pete's going to attack with Nd5 now.....
moves.17... Nd5 18. Rc2: If Nxc3 then Rxc3 I'm on the defensive here...not good.
moves.18... Nb4 19. Rd2: this is a sad sad game now!  If I didn't move my Rook it was lost and now my K is pinned by the N. I had thought of Nd5+ but would have ended up losing my N for nothing
moves.19... Nxa2+ 20. Kb1: I'm going to lose the pawn after NxN b2xN Rxc3
moves.20... Nxc3+ 21. bxc3 Rxc3 22. Kb2: I figure that I need to get my king out of the corner and off the white squares ....thought about Rd2 or Rc1.
moves.22... Rc5 23. Rc2: a new day a new perspective.  I needed to get the B and Rook off the same file ....offering again a Rook swap.
moves.23... Rxc2+ 24. Bxc2 a5 25. Rc1: Want to get the rook out and on an open file  also get a barrier his king can't move over as all the action I suspect will initially be on the Queen side of the board.
moves.25... b5 26. Bd3: I needed to get the B and R off the same file. If he moves Rc8 then RxR BxR and Bxb5.
moves.26... Rb8: As all the action is on the Queen side every plan I had could be countered easily by Pete so it was a no win situation (3 pawns down) so resigned at this stage as believed I wouldn't learn anything more by going through the pain.....of checkmate!
